Help Simkyn for the fals clerkis fight
This Iohn stert up as fast as euer he might
And graspid by the wallis to and fro
To finde a staff and she stirt up also
And knew the Estirs bette than did this Iohn
And bi the walle a staff she toke anon̄
And saugh a litle shymering of light
For at an hool the mone shone in ful bright
And bi the light she saugh hem both two
But sicurli she nyst not who was who
And as she saugh a white thing in hir iye
And whan she gan this white thing aspye
She wend the clerc had worn̄ a volupere
And with the staff she drue ay nere ⁊and ner͗e
And wend haue hitte this Aleyn atte fulle
And smote the Milner͗e on the pillid sculle
That doun he goth and cried harou I dye
This clerkis bete him wel and lete him lye
And greythen hem and toke her hors anon̄
And eke their mele / ⁊and on their wey they gon̄
And at Milne yit they toke her cake
Of halue a busshel flour riȝt wel y bake
¶ Thus is the proude Milner wel y bete
And hath y lost the grinding of the whete
And y paide for the Souper eueridel
Of Aleyn and of Iohn that bett him wel
His wyf is swyued and his doughtꝰir alsoealsoalse
Lo such it is a Milner to be fals
And therto this ꝓprouerbe is seid ful soþe
Him thar not deme wel that ille doth
A gilour shal himselue begilid be
And god that sittis in his maieste
Saue al this cumpany gret ⁊and smale
Thus haue I quitte the Milners tale
Oure host saugh wel þat þe briȝt sıı̄unne

The fourth part and half an hour͗e ⁊and mor͗e
And though he were not depe y stert in lore
He wist it was the eight and twenty day

And saugh wel that the shadou of euꝰery tre
